alert.note: Alert for Traverse (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 15 at 1:02AM CDT until further notice by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...Observed flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity for the following rivers in Minnesota... 12 Mile Creek near Wheaton affecting Traverse County. .Warm temperatures will melt snowpack and increase river flows. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring. * WHERE...12 Mile Creek near Wheaton. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, 670th Street begins to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:00 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 19.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 12:00 AM CDT Saturday was 19.1 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abr. The next statement will be issued Sunday, or sooner if necessary.
